Well, I found that a 280 piece marching band did a quite wonderful job on Amazing Grace. The crowd that had continued to chatter and chatter through the preformances of other bands was stunned to silence, and some had tears in their eyes. The band director muted the brass sections at one point by having them execute some complicated wheels that turned them 180 degrees from the stands. Being brass, they were still audible, but as soft harmony for the clarinets, saxes, and flutes. In the finalle, the brass had moved to a position where another massive wheel formed an inverted chevron facing the stands and marching slowly straight forward, with more than 20 trombones right in the middle surrounded by the other brass. Even the judges froze and stopped taking notes.
 
 Both of my sons played trombone in that band and neither understood the power to their performance. When they finished the director had the biggest smile on his face that you can imagine. The band received top marks. But I still don't see what that has to do with anything more than an laughable and unfounded reference to Christ.
